metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14316 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A parameter verification issue was discovered in Xen through 4.9.x. The function `alloc_heap_pages` allows callers to specify the first NUMA node that should be used for allocations through the `memflags` parameter; the node is extracted using the `MEMF_get_node` macro. While the function checks to see if the special constant `NUMA_NO_NODE` is specified, it otherwise does not handle the case where `node >= MAX_NUMNODES`. This allows an out-of-bounds access to an internal array.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14316` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.6 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.4
libxenstore3.0 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.4
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.6.5-0ubuntu1.4
